Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Kohl?s Department Stores Inc. agreed to pay a civil penalty of $425,000 to resolve CPSC staff allegations that it knowingly failed to report to CPSC immediately, as required by federal law, that children's hooded sweatshirts it sold had drawstrings at the neck.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2009/Kohls-Department-Stores-Agrees-to-Pay-425000-Civil-Penalty-for-Failing-to-Report-Drawstrings-in-Childrens-Sweatshirts

Description: Eight firms agreed to pay a total of $320,000 to settle allegations that they failed to report to the CPSC, as required by federal law, that their children's hooded sweatshirts or jackets were sold with drawstrings at the hood and neck and thus posed a strangulation hazard.
Info Source: https://www.cpsc.gov/Newsroom/News-Releases/2008/Eight-Firms-Agree-To-Pay-320000-For-Failing-To-Timely-Report-Drawstrings-In-Childrens-Outerwear

Private Litigation Case Title: Costello et al v. Kohl's Illinois,Inc., et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/743824/kohl-s-4m-manager-ot-settlement-gets-final-approval

Private Litigation Case Title: Croul v. Kohl's Department Stores, Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/320020/kohl-s-brings-end-to-ot-class-action-with-settlement

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-major-us-companies-reduce-lead

Description: Kohl's Department Stores, Inc. agreed to pay $200,000 in settlement of allegations its pricing policies and advertisements were deceptive.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20021226134322/http://www.ink.org/public/ksag/contents/news-releases/2000news/kohls.htm

Description: Kohl's Department Stores agreed to pay nearly $1 million in settlement of allegations it violated consumer protection laws by charging customers a higher price than advertised on store shelves and signage, and that it did not adequately disclose how discounts were applied to its loyalty program. The settlement was with the District Attorneys of Santa Cruz, Fresno, Shasta and Riverside counties and split equally between them after deducting the Riverside County Division of Weights & Measures costs of $4,718.
Info Source: https://www.co.fresno.ca.us/Home/ShowDocument?id=10364

Description: Kohl's agreed to pay $409,500 in settlement of allegations by the District Attorneys in Santa Clara, Santa Cruz, Fresno and Sacramento counties that it inaccurately priced items at its stores, and that sale prices and discounts were not always registered at check-out scanners.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2013/Kohl-Pay-Scanner-Suit.aspx

Description: Kohl's Department Stores, Inc. agreed to pay a civil penalty of $220,000 to settle Federal Trade Commission allegations that the Wisconsin-based retailer violated the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) by refusing to provide complete records of transactions to consumers whose personal information was used by identity thieves.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2020/06/ftc-reaches-settlement-kohls-over-allegations-it-failed-provide

Private Litigation Case Title: Collins v. Kohl's Dept Stores Inc et al
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/1346889/kohl-s-workers-land-2-9m-deal-to-end-overtime-claims
